There's a special irony when Google CEO Eric Schmidt suggests-as he did in a speech to the Council on Foreign Relations last November-that China's government will find it impossible to censor a billion phones that are trying to express themselves. Eric Schmidt is rich because his company sells precisely targeted ads against hundreds of millions of search requests per day. If Google can zero in like that, so can China's censors. At practice Wednesday, Michael Vick loosened up throwing passes to Falcons quarterback Matt Ryan, who is making his first Pro Bowl appearance in his third season and succeeded Michael Vick in Atlanta. Matt is great. The coaching staff is great. We're just having a good time, he said.`` I like what they're doing in the offense and it's been easy.
